Arafat? Maybe, but not for failure to stop the killing in the middle east?
 
 http://www.nobel.se/peace/laureates/1994/
 
 Rabin? He wanted peace. Him and Arafat were the best chance for peace. His own assasin words: "I did this to stop the peace process," he said. "We need to be coldhearted."
 
 Rabin's assasin? Most definately will burn in ****.
 
 Sharon? Most definatley will burn in ****.
 Looks like he will finally be held accountable for crimes against humanity.
 
 http://www.palestinemonitor.org/israelipoli/sharon_trial_campaign_gathers_mo.htm
 
 Ask yourself these questions? Who is evil in this game? The Nobel Peace Prize winner? Or the man on trial for crimes against humanity.
